Package com.example.qrazyqrsrus

Class FirebaseDB

java.lang.Object
com.example.qrazyqrsrus.FirebaseDB
public class FirebaseDB extends Object
This is a utility class that does all the Firebase related actions.

    • getAllEvents

      public void getAllEvents(ArrayList<Event> eventList, android.widget.ArrayAdapter<Event> eventArrayAdapter)
      Retrieves all events in the events collection
      Parameters:
      eventList - The list we're going to hold the events in.
      eventArrayAdapter - The ArrayAdapter of eventList.

    • getAllEvents

      public void getAllEvents(FirebaseDB.GetAllEventsCallBack callBack)
      Retrieves all events from the Firestore database and constructs a list of Event objects. Each event document is transformed into an Event object which is then added to a list. Once all documents have been processed, this list is passed to the provided FirebaseDB.GetAllEventsCallBack callback.

      If the operation is successful, FirebaseDB.GetAllEventsCallBack.onResult(ArrayList) is called with the list of events. In case of failure, an error log is generated and no further action is taken. The callback is not called with a failure indicator, which means error handling should be managed externally based on application needs.

      Parameters:
      callBack - The FirebaseDB.GetAllEventsCallBack callback to handle the result. This callback gets a list of Event objects on successful retrieval, allowing further processing such as updating UI or handling event data.

    • getAllUsers

      public void getAllUsers(ArrayList<Attendee> attendeeList, android.widget.ArrayAdapter<Attendee> attendeeArrayAdapter)
      Retrieves all users in the users collection
      Parameters:

      attendeeArrayAdapter - The ArrayAdapter of attendeeList.

      Parameters:

      callback - The OnFinishedCallback that we will invoke once firebase is done it's operation

    • checkUnique

      public void checkUnique(String qrContent, int mode, FirebaseDB.UniqueCheckCallBack callBack)
      \ Check whether or not the content of a QR code is already in use by an event created in the app.
      Parameters:
      qrContent - a string that represents the content field of the QR code we are checking
      mode - an integer: 0 if we are checking promotional qr codes, 1 if we are checking checkin qr codes
      callBack - a class that implements the UniqueCheckCallBack that will allow you to handle the boolean result if there is an already existing event with the qr code.

    • findEventWithQR

      public void findEventWithQR(String qrContent, int mode, FirebaseDB.MatchingQRCallBack callBack)
      \ Check if there exists an event with the matching promotional or checkin qr code
      Parameters:
      qrContent - a string that represents the content field of the QR code we are checking
      mode - an integer: 0 if we are checking promotional qr codes, 1 if we are checking checkin qr codes
      callBack - a class that implements the MatchingQRCallBack that will allow you to handle the event with the matching qr code

    • getEventsMadeByUser

      public void getEventsMadeByUser(Attendee user, ArrayList<Event> eventArrayList, EventListAdapter adapter)
      Retrieves all the events an user has signed up to
      Parameters:
      user - the user who as signed up to events
      eventArrayList - the list you want to add the events to

    • addCheckIn

      public void addCheckIn(CheckIn checkIn)
      Adds a new CheckIn object to the Firestore database within the `checkInsCollection`. Upon successful addition, the method assigns the Firestore-generated document ID back to the CheckIn object and calls updateCheckIn to update any necessary information within the database based on the newly added check-in.
      Parameters:
      checkIn - The CheckIn object to be added to the Firestore database. This object contains all necessary information about the check-in, such as attendee ID, event ID, and geolocation coordinates.

    • updateCheckIn

      public void updateCheckIn(CheckIn checkIn)
      Updates the specified check-in document in the Firestore database with new information from the provided CheckIn object. This method updates the check-in document with the latest data, such as attendee document ID, event document ID, geolocation coordinates, and the number of check-ins.
      Parameters:
      checkIn - The CheckIn object containing updated information to be stored in the database.

    • checkInAlreadyExists

      public void checkInAlreadyExists(String eventDocId, String attendeeDocId, FirebaseDB.UniqueCheckInCallBack callBack)
      Checks if a check-in already exists for a given attendee and event combination in the Firestore database. This method queries the `checkInsCollection` to find any existing check-in documents that match the specified attendee and event document IDs. The result of this query is passed to the provided FirebaseDB.UniqueCheckInCallBack.
      Parameters:
      eventDocId - The document ID of the event to check for an existing check-in.
      attendeeDocId - The document ID of the attendee to check for an existing check-in.
      callBack - The FirebaseDB.UniqueCheckInCallBack callback to handle the result of the check. The callback will be invoked with a boolean indicating whether the check-in is unique (i.e., does not exist) and with the CheckIn object if an existing check-in is found.

    • addCheckInToEvent

      public void addCheckInToEvent(CheckIn checkIn, Event event)
      This functions creates a new checkIn for the user that is joining the event, and adds the documentID of the checkIn to the event's field in firebase
      Parameters:
      checkIn - the object representing the checkIn. this holds the document ID of the event, and attendee that is checking in
      event - the event we are changing

      Parameters:

      Parameters:

    • attemptAdminLogin

      public void attemptAdminLogin(String username, String password, FirebaseDB.AttemptLoginCallback callback)
      This function looks for a document with matching admin login details to the user's input
      Parameters:
      username - The username input by the user
      password - The password input by the user
      callback - The callback we invoked to tell if the user input valid or invalid admin login credentials

    • userCheckedIntoEvent

      public void userCheckedIntoEvent(Attendee user, Event event, FirebaseDB.UniqueCheckCallBack callBack)
      Checks if a specific user has checked into a specific event. Queries the check-ins collection to find any check-ins that match both the attendee's document ID and the event's document ID. The result of the query (whether any check-ins were found) is passed to the provided FirebaseDB.UniqueCheckCallBack.
      Parameters:
      user - The Attendee who is being checked.
      event - The Event to check the attendee against.
      callBack - The FirebaseDB.UniqueCheckCallBack to handle whether the attendee has checked into the event.

    • getEventCheckedInUsersGeoLocation

      public void getEventCheckedInUsersGeoLocation(Event event, ArrayList<String> attendeeDataList, ArrayList latitudeList, ArrayList longitudeList)
      Retrieves the geolocation data for users who have checked into a specific event. This method queries the check-ins collection for all check-ins associated with the given event's document ID, extracting the latitude and longitude for each check-in. These coordinates are added to the provided latitude and longitude lists. Additional attendee data, such as document IDs, are added to the attendeeDataList.
      Parameters:
      event - The Event for which to retrieve checked-in users' geolocations.
      attendeeDataList - An ArrayList to hold data of the attendees who have checked in.
      latitudeList - An ArrayList to hold the latitude values of the checked-in locations.
      longitudeList - An ArrayList to hold the longitude values of the checked-in locations.

    • getToken

      public void getToken(FirebaseDB.GetTokenCallback callback)
      Retrieves the current instance's Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) token. This token is used to uniquely identify the app instance for push notifications. The retrieved token is passed to the provided FirebaseDB.GetTokenCallback.
      Parameters:
      callback - The FirebaseDB.GetTokenCallback to handle the retrieved FCM token.

    • subscribeAttendeeToEventTopic

      public void subscribeAttendeeToEventTopic(String topicName)
      This function subscribes a user to the topic that FCM will send new announcements to as push notifications
      Parameters:
      topicName - The name of the topic in FCM that the user is subscribing to

    • getEventById

      public void getEventById(String eventId, FirebaseDB.GetEventCallback callback)
      Retrieves an event by its unique identifier from the Firestore database. This method queries the Firestore database for an event document using the specified event ID. If the document is successfully retrieved and exists, it constructs an Event object from the document's data and invokes the FirebaseDB.GetEventCallback.onSuccess(Event) method of the provided callback with the event object. If the document does not exist or an error occurs during the query, the appropriate failure method of the callback is invoked.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique identifier of the event to retrieve.
      callback - The FirebaseDB.GetEventCallback implementation to handle the response. The onSuccess method is called with the event object if the event is found. The onFailure method is called with an error message if the event is not found or if an error occurs during the database query.

    • getGeolocations

      public void getGeolocations(Event event, FirebaseDB.GetMapMarkersCallback callback)
      Gets two lists, one for the CheckIn instances and one for the names of the attendees
      Parameters:
      event - the event we want to get the check in locations
      callback - The callback we invoked to return the two lists
